title: Programming in Base R
text:
Task 1: Basic Vector Practice

Set the vectors for pre_measures and post_measures:


pre_measures <- c(120, 151, 125, 126, 115, 132, 132, 129, 134, 139, 127, 122, 127, 135, 133, 128, 147, 138, 140, 132)
post_measures <- c(127, 145, 135, 122, 115, 122, 123, 126, 126, 129, 132, 146, 120, 114, 121, 120, 128, 120, 133, 115)


Update the names for each element to Subject_x:


names(pre_measures) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")
names(post_measures) <- paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_")


Create another vector representing the difference in the pre and post measurements for each subject:


delta_measures <- post_measures - pre_measures
head(delta_measures)

Subject_1 Subject_2 Subject_3 Subject_4 Subject_5 Subject_6 
        7        -6        10        -4         0       -10 



Calculate average decrease in blood pressure over all subjects:


mean(delta_measures)

[1] -5.65



Identify the subjects that experienced a positive change (decreased blood pressure measurement):


positive_change_indices <- which(delta_measures < 0)
head(positive_change_indices)

Subject_2 Subject_4 Subject_6 Subject_7 Subject_8 Subject_9 
        2         4         6         7         8         9 



Now, subset the delta vector for only those with the positive change:


positive_change_subjects <- delta_measures[positive_change_indices]
head(positive_change_subjects)

Subject_2 Subject_4 Subject_6 Subject_7 Subject_8 Subject_9 
       -6        -4       -10        -9        -3        -8 



Lastly, calculate average decrease in blood pressure of those who experienced a decrease:


mean(positive_change_subjects)

[1] -10.6




Task 2: Basic Data Frame Practice

Create a data frame with a column for each of:


patient
pre_bp
post_bp
diff_bp


bp_df = data.frame(
  "patient" = paste("Subject", 1:20, sep = "_"),
  "pre_bp" = pre_measures,
  "post_bp" = post_measures,
  "diff_bp" = delta_measures,
  row.names = NULL
  )
head(bp_df)

    patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
1 Subject_1    120     127       7
2 Subject_2    151     145      -6
3 Subject_3    125     135      10
4 Subject_4    126     122      -4
5 Subject_5    115     115       0
6 Subject_6    132     122     -10



Access the rows corresponding to negative values of the column diff_bp:


bp_df[bp_df$diff_bp<0,]

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp
2   Subject_2    151     145      -6
4   Subject_4    126     122      -4
6   Subject_6    132     122     -10
7   Subject_7    132     123      -9
8   Subject_8    129     126      -3
9   Subject_9    134     126      -8
10 Subject_10    139     129     -10
13 Subject_13    127     120      -7
14 Subject_14    135     114     -21
15 Subject_15    133     121     -12
16 Subject_16    128     120      -8
17 Subject_17    147     128     -19
18 Subject_18    138     120     -18
19 Subject_19    140     133      -7
20 Subject_20    132     115     -17



Add a new column, TRUE if post_bp < 120:


bp_df$post_bp_under_120 = bp_df$post_bp<120


Print the finished data frame nicely:


knitr::kable(bp_df)

pre_bp
post_bp
diff_bp

Task 3: List practice

Create a new data frame to represent this additional set of subjects that received placebos:


placebo_df <- data.frame(
  "patient" = paste("Subject",1:20,sep="_"),
  "pre_bp" = c(138, 135, 147, 117, 152, 134, 114, 121, 131, 130),
  "post_bp" = c(105, 136, 123, 130, 134, 143, 135, 139, 120, 124)
)

#adding diff and under_120 cols
placebo_df$diff_bp <- placebo_df$post_bp - placebo_df$pre_bp
placebo_df$post_bp_under_120 <- placebo_df$diff_bp<120

head(placebo_df)

    patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp_under_120
1 Subject_1    138     105     -33              TRUE
2 Subject_2    135     136       1              TRUE
3 Subject_3    147     123     -24              TRUE
4 Subject_4    117     130      13              TRUE
5 Subject_5    152     134     -18              TRUE
6 Subject_6    134     143       9              TRUE



Now make a list whose first element is the original treatment group and whose second element is the placebo group:


patient_list <- list(
  "treatment" = bp_df,
  "placebo" = placebo_df
  )


Show three ways to access the first element of this list:


patient_list[1]

$treatment
      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp_under_120
1   Subject_1    120     127       7             FALSE
2   Subject_2    151     145      -6             FALSE
3   Subject_3    125     135      10             FALSE
4   Subject_4    126     122      -4             FALSE
5   Subject_5    115     115       0              TRUE
6   Subject_6    132     122     -10             FALSE

9   Subject_9    134     126      -8             FALSE

19 Subject_19    140     133      -7             FALSE

      patient pre_bp post_bp diff_bp post_bp_under_120

Access the pre_bp column of the placebo element with one line of code:


patient_list[[2]]$pre_bp

 [1] 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131 130 138 135 147 117 152 134 114 121 131
[20] 130
